title: Calories in a Piece of Cake
meta_description: Discover calories in a piece of cake, including carbs, fat, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per slice with easy tweaks and FAQs.
h1: Calories in a Piece of Cake
assumptions: Standard slice of frosted chocolate cake (~100 g, 1/12 of a 9x13 inch cake); includes buttercream frosting.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, frosting type, portion size, and ingredients; homemade vs. store-bought differs. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical piece of frosted chocolate cake contains about 350 kcal.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Carrot cake with cream cheese frosting (per piece)

faqs.q: How many calories in a piece of cake?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard frosted chocolate slice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a piece of cake?
faqs.a: Roughly 50 g carbs, including 35 g sugars, per piece.
Yes, around 15 g total fat (6 g saturated) from butter and frosting.

faqs.q: How does portion size affect calories in cake?
faqs.a: A larger piece (150 g) could add 150+ kcal; smaller halves it.
Angel food cake or fruit-based versions can be 150-250 kcal per piece.
